alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Marshall (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 8:49PM CST until February 24 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Shelbyville affecting Bedford and Marshall Counties. For the Duck River...including Shelbyville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Duck River Near Shelbyville. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Areas along the river from Normandy Dam to near Henry Horton State Park begin to be flooded, including agricultural land and access points. In Shelbyville, water begins to approach properties adjacent to the river on S Cannon Blvd between the Hwy 64-Lewis Ave junction and the bridge, and Fisherman`s Park and River Bottom Park are both flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 22.4 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise. - Action stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CST.
